active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare token-based authentication (e.g., JWT bearer tokens) with session-based authentication. Debate advantages/disadvantages in scalability, security (e.g., CSRF resistance), and statelessness. Use real-world examples like single-page apps vs traditional web apps.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Generate 3 plausible distractors based on common misconceptions (e.g., 'JWTs are encrypted' vs signed; session vs token confusion; unsecured alg:none as secure).
Use partial truths (e.g., correct term but wrong context) or real-world pitfalls (e.g., ignoring revocation).
Ensure distractors test analysis/evaluation (e.g., mix up claims like iss vs sub).
Balance difficulty: 1 easy (obvious wrong), 1 medium (common error), 1 hard (subtle trap).

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education on 'Token-Based Authentication' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Access Control for Data > Identity and Authentication Management > Token-Based Authentication). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, research context (JWT RFC 7519 structure: header.claims.signature; bearer tokens; unsecured JWTs risks like alg:none; best practices: HTTPS, revocation, validation libs; comparisons to SAML/OAuth/session auth; sources: jwt.io, auth0.com/docs), and voter consensus for completeness/pedagogy. Generate flashcards following the exact schema: MCQ front (Q + A/B/C/D options), back (correct_answer letter+text, explanation with Bloom/layer refs/sources/why distractors wrong, distractors array), metadata (bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, topic_hierarchy). Incorporate active learning: Link explanations to discussion/peer/problem-solving where relevant (e.g., 'Relates to debate on statelessness'). Ensure progressive scaffolding: Layer 1 foundation terms; Layer 2 JWT components/unsecured risks; Layer 3 implementation pseudocode/best practices; Layer 4 integrations/comparisons. Distractors per protocol: 3 plausible based on misconceptions/pitfalls. Output 50 JSON flashcards in array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {...}, 'metadata': {...}}, ...]. No extra text.
